title: Nagarhole National Park
short_description: Known as the Rajiv Gandhi National Park, this reserve is famous for its dense forests and large elephant herds.
long_description: Nagarhole National Park (Rajiv Gandhi National Park) connects with Bandipur National Park to forming a vital corridor for wildlife in the Nilgiri Biosphere Reserve. Located in the Kodagu and Mysore districts of Karnataka, it takes its name from 'Naga' (snake) and 'Hole' (river), referring to the winding path of the river that flows through it. The park has rich forest cover, small streams, hills, valleys and waterfalls. It has a high density of tigers and is one of the best places in India to spot leopards and black panthers. The Kabini river reservoir separates it from Bandipur.
wildlife_significance: Vital corridor for Asian Elephants. High density of Leopards and Tigers.
major_experiences: Jeep Safari in Kabini (famous for Black Panther)
guides_and_tips: Kabini side (South) is more premium with better sightings. Veeranahosahalli (North) is budget-friendly.
how_to_reach: By Air: Mysore (96 km) or Bangalore (236 km). By Road: 2-3 hours from Mysore.
permits_and_fees: Safari booking strictly online via Jungle Lodges & Resorts or Nagarahole Tiger Reserve website.
conservation_notes: Successful relocation of tribal settlements from core areas. Strong anti-poaching camps.
sample_itinerary: Day 1: Arrive Kabini River Lodge. Lunch. Afternoon Jeep/Boat Safari. Dinner. Day 2: Morning Safari. Breakfast. Coracle ride. Relax. Evening Safari. Day 3: Nature walk. Check out.
safety_tips: Do not get out of the vehicle. Elephants on the Kabini bridge can be aggressive.

entry_fees.notes: Entry fee inclusive in safari ticket usually.

operating_season.season_notes: Open year-round. Boat safaris good in summer.

pricing_metadata.disclaimer: Jungle Lodges packages include safari, stay and meals.
